org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainersample
Class EntityContainerFilteringApplication

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.Application
      org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainersample.AbstractEntityApplication
          org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainersample.EntityContainerFilteringApplication
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.terminal.Terminal.ErrorListener, com.vaadin.terminal.URIHandler, com.vaadin.ui.Button.ClickListener, java.io.Serializable
public class EntityContainerFilteringApplication
extends AbstractEntityApplication

Example application demonstrating how to use the generic CritQueryDefinition to fetch entities and to perform filtering on a container. In this version, we do not need to extend CritQueryDefinition, we only use the built-in features for filtering.

Author:
Jean-Fran√ßois Lamy

Method Detail

createTaskContainer

protected CriteriaContainer<Task> createTaskContainer()
Returns:
the container used to feed the table

doFiltering

protected void doFiltering()
Manipulate the query definition to add/remove filtering. In this version, we use the generic filtering mechanism provided by Container.Filterable See EntityCustomFilteringApplication and EntityCustomFilteringApplication.CustomFilteringQueryDefinition for an alternate approach where arbitrary complex filtering can be done through methods.

defineTableColumns

protected void defineTableColumns()
define the columns visible and the order in which they appear. If we don't do this we get all the columns as returned by the database.
